title: A randomized controlled study of dose‑finding, efficacy, and safety of mulberry leaves on glycemic profiles in obese persons with borderline diabetes
results_summary: This randomized controlled dose-finding trial evaluated mulberry leaves with DNJ content in obese adults with borderline diabetes. Results showed that improved postprandial glycemia with identified effective doses; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “A randomized controlled study of dose‑finding, efficacy, and safety of mulberry leaves on glycemic profiles in obese persons with borderline diabetes.” PubMed, 2020, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/32147046/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Mulberry leaf extract improves postprandial glucose, insulin, and C-peptide responses in impaired fasting glucose
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial evaluated mulberry leaf aqueous extract in adults with impaired fasting glucose. Results showed that reduced postprandial glucose, insulin, and C-peptide responses versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Mulberry leaf extract improves postprandial glucose, insulin, and C-peptide responses in impaired fasting glucose.” PubMed, 2015, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/25343729/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Effect of mulberry leaf extract with enriched 1‑deoxynojirimycin on long-term glycemic control
population: Adults with fasting plasma glucose 110–140 mg/dL
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial evaluated mulberry leaf extract enriched with 1-deoxynojirimycin in adults with elevated fasting plasma glucose. Results showed that reduced postprandial glucose and improved glycemic indices versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Effect of mulberry leaf extract with enriched 1‑deoxynojirimycin on long-term glycemic control.” PubMed, 2011, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24843505/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Mulberry leaf extract reduces the glycemic indexes of four common dietary carbohydrates
results_summary: This randomized crossover clinical trial evaluated mulberry leaf extract in healthy adults. Results showed that reduced glycemic index values of carbohydrate foods via α‑glucosidase inhibition; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Mulberry leaf extract reduces the glycemic indexes of four common dietary carbohydrates.” PubMed, 2018, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30142838/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Mulberry leaf extract improves glycaemic response and insulinaemic response to sucrose in healthy individuals
results_summary: This randomized double-blind crossover trial evaluated mulberry leaf extract added to sucrose in healthy adults. Results showed that lower postprandial glucose and insulin responses versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Mulberry leaf extract improves glycaemic response and insulinaemic response to sucrose in healthy individuals.” PubMed, 2021, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33858439/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: A Randomized, Placebo‑Controlled Crossover Study to Assess a Mulberry Leaf Extract‑Based Blend on Glycemic Response in Type 2 Diabetes
results_summary: This randomized double-blind crossover trial evaluated mulberry leaf extract-based blend in adults with type 2 diabetes. Results showed that reduced 3‑hour postprandial glucose compared with placebo blend; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “A Randomized, Placebo‑Controlled Crossover Study to Assess a Mulberry Leaf Extract‑Based Blend on Glycemic Response in Type 2 Diabetes.” PubMed, 2023, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/36855010/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Milk with Mulberry Leaf Extract, Vegetable Oil, and Inulin Reduce Early Glucose and Insulin Response in Healthy Adults in China: Randomized Controlled Trial
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated milk fortified with mulberry leaf extract, vegetable oil, and inulin in healthy adults. Results showed that reduced early postprandial glucose and insulin versus control milk; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Milk with Mulberry Leaf Extract, Vegetable Oil, and Inulin Reduce Early Glucose and Insulin Response in Healthy Adults in China: Randomized Controlled Trial.” PubMed, 2025, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40419093/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Evaluation of the Postprandial‑Hyperglycemia‑Reducing Effect of Mulberry (Morus alba) Leaf Tea Using CGM
results_summary: This randomized double-blind crossover trial evaluated mulberry leaf tea in adults consuming tea before meals. Results showed that reduced CGM-measured postprandial excursions versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Evaluation of the Postprandial‑Hyperglycemia‑Reducing Effect of Mulberry (Morus alba) Leaf Tea Using CGM.” PubMed, 2025, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40732933/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Morus alba leaf extract affects metabolic profiles among adults with type 2 diabetes
results_summary: This randomized double-blind placebo-controlled trial evaluated morus alba leaf extract in adults with type 2 diabetes mellitus. Results showed that improved HDL cholesterol, insulin, and oxidative stress markers with other endpoints unchanged; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Morus alba leaf extract affects metabolic profiles among adults with type 2 diabetes.” PubMed, 2022, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35623877/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Bioequivalence of Mulberry Fruit Extract and 1‑Deoxynojirimycin for Postprandial Blood Glucose Lowering: A Randomized Trial in Humans
results_summary: This randomized crossover bioequivalence trial evaluated mulberry fruit extract compared with 1‑deoxynojirimycin in healthy adults. Results showed that bioequivalence for postprandial glucose lowering; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Bioequivalence of Mulberry Fruit Extract and 1‑Deoxynojirimycin for Postprandial Blood Glucose Lowering: A Randomized Trial in Humans.” PubMed, 2025, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40419090/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.
